definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Its descendants will reign over it forever, whether gifted or boobies .
sentences.chinese: 它子子孙孙，不论贤愚，都永远身居王位。

sentences.english: We can be able to leave the legacy to the next generations.
sentences.chinese: 我们有能力将奥运遗产传给子子孙孙。

sentences.english: Teach them to your children and to their children after them.
sentences.chinese: 总要传给你的子子孙孙。

definition: from generation to generation/generation after generation
to multiply/to reproduce/to increase gradually in number or quantity
offspring/future generations/younger generation of a family/junior members of a group
passed on from generation to generation (idiom); to hand down
